text: The elephants of a circus that arrived in Mexico City escaped from the station and, stung by the horns of the locomotives, sprinted down the streets, frightened, making a racket. A poor man went out with his wife and daughter to eat with friends and brought his two glasses. When they came near him, the elephant shook off his horn. The animal turned, he jumped up with a roar, he fell on the ground and he sat down. I find the pain of the wife and daughter even more horrible, for they cannot even tell what the poor man died of. If you say, “He killed an elephant,” everyone laughs. FIN
title: La elefanta
author: Alfonso Reyes
